name: Iraq
description: Iraq, officially the Republic of Iraq, is a country in Western Asia. It is strategically located at the confluence of the Tigris and Euphrates rivers, often referred to as the 'Cradle of Civilization'.  Iraq possesses a rich and complex history, having been the heart of ancient Mesopotamian empires like Sumer, Akkad, Babylon, and Assyria.  Today, it faces significant challenges including political instability, economic hardship, and the ongoing effects of conflict. Despite these difficulties, Iraq boasts a unique cultural heritage, diverse landscapes, and significant archaeological sites.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Iraq's population is a diverse mix of Arab, Kurdish, Turkmen, and other ethnic groups.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban centers, particularly Baghdad, Mosul, and Basra.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Baghdad is the largest city in Iraq and the country's political, cultural, and economic center.
quickFacts.detail: It’s located on the Tigris River and has a history stretching back over 2,000 years.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Iraq is a relatively large country with diverse geographical features.
quickFacts.detail: It borders Syria to the northeast, Turkey to the north, Iran to the northeast, Jordan to the southeast, and Saudi Arabia to the southwest.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Arabic is the official language of Iraq.
quickFacts.detail: Kurdish is also widely spoken, particularly in the Kurdistan Region.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Iraqi Dinar is the official currency of Iraq.
quickFacts.detail: Its value fluctuates significantly due to economic and political factors.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Iraq's economy is heavily reliant on oil production.
quickFacts.detail: Non-oil sectors, such as agriculture and tourism, are developing but remain relatively small.

climateData.title: Climate of Iraq
climateData.description: Iraq experiences a hot desert climate with significant seasonal variations. Summers are extremely hot and dry, while winters are mild and relatively wet. Rainfall is sparse and unevenly distributed throughout the year.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is the hottest and driest period of the year, with scorching temperatures and minimal rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to cool down, and rainfall increases slightly. The landscape transforms with vibrant colors.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild and relatively wet, with occasional cold snaps. Snowfall is rare in the central and southern regions but more common in the northern mountains.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a welcome return of warmth and rainfall, transforming the landscape into a lush green paradise.

naturalWonders.name: Iraqi Marshes
naturalWonders.description: The Iraqi Marshes, also known as the Southern Marshes, are a vast network of wetlands in southern Iraq. They are a unique and vital ecosystem, renowned for their biodiversity and traditional way of life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These marshes are a UNESCO World Heritage Site and are home to a diverse array of plant and animal life, including the rare and endangered Greater Marsh Rabbit. They are a crucial habitat for migratory birds and provide essential flood control.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide to navigate the marshes.
Respect the local culture and traditions.

scientificData.Biodiversity: Over 300 bird species, 40 mammal species, and numerous fish and reptile species

naturalWonders.name: Hajastan Mountains
naturalWonders.description: The Hajastan Mountains are a rugged mountain range in northern Iraq, bordering Turkey and Iran. They are known for their dramatic landscapes, diverse flora and fauna, and historical significance.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These mountains are home to several peaks over 3,000 meters in elevation and offer stunning views of the surrounding plains. They are a popular destination for hiking and mountaineering, and contain numerous ancient monasteries and ruins.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out.

scientificData.Geology: Primarily composed of limestone and sandstone
scientificData.Vegetation: Alpine meadows, coniferous forests, and rocky slopes

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Iraq
ecosystemData.overview: Iraq’s ecosystems are diverse, ranging from arid deserts to fertile wetlands and mountainous regions. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, many of which are threatened by habitat loss and human activities.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Iraq's land area is protected within national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Iraq’s vast deserts, such as the Arabian Desert, are characterized by extreme temperatures, sparse vegetation, and unique wildlife adapted to arid conditions.

statistics.details: Over 85% of Iraq’s land area is covered by desert.
Includes reptiles, insects, and small mammals.

notableSpecies.name: Arabian Sand Cat
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and elusive wild cat adapted to desert life.

notableSpecies.name: Desert Fox
notableSpecies.significance: A small, nocturnal fox that hunts rodents and insects.

threats: Habitat loss due to urbanization and agriculture

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetland Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: The Iraqi Marshes and other wetlands are vital ecosystems that provide habitat for a wide range of plant and animal life, as well as important ecological services.

statistics.details: The Iraqi Marshes are one of the largest wetlands in the Middle East.

notableSpecies.name: Greater Marsh Rabbit
notableSpecies.significance: A critically endangered rabbit found only in the Iraqi Marshes.

notableSpecies.name: White-winged Tern
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory seabird that breeds in the marshes.

threats: Pollution from industrial and agricultural sources

activities.title: Activities in Iraq
activities.description: Iraq offers a range of activities for travelers, from exploring ancient ruins to experiencing the natural beauty of the country’s diverse landscapes.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the rugged mountains and desert landscapes of Iraq on foot.

activities.name: Hajastan Mountain Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the Hajastan Mountains, offering stunning views and opportunities to spot wildlife.
activities.requirements: Good hiking boots, water, sunscreen, and a guide.

activities.name: Desert Hiking
activities.description: Explore the vast deserts of Iraq, discovering hidden oases and ancient ruins.
activities.requirements: Sunscreen, hat, plenty of water, and appropriate clothing.
safety: Avoid hiking during the hottest part of the day

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities in the Iraqi Marshes and along the Tigris and Euphrates rivers.

activities.name: Marsh Boat Tour
activities.description: Explore the Iraqi Marshes by traditional boat, observing wildlife and learning about local culture.
activities.requirements: Comfortable clothing, sunscreen, and insect repellent.
safety: Follow the guidance of your boatman

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, sunscreen, hat, sunglasses.
clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves.
clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, modest clothing for visiting religious sites.

equipment.basic: Passport, visa (if required), travel insurance, first-aid kit.
equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, backpack, water bottle, map, compass.
